items.title: Africa: M23 Rebels Claim Control of Goma in Congo
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
<article>Rebel group M23, aligned with Rwanda, says it seized the key trading hub of Goma in the Democratic Republic of Congo. M23 said all Congolese military personnel must hand over weapons to UN peacekeepers. Congo's government and army have not confirmed the city has fallen. The US, Congo and United Nations experts accuse M23, which already controls the region’s biggest tantalum-ore mine, of smuggling minerals to Rwanda. Bloomberg's Ondiro Oganga reports from Kigali.
--------

items.title: Trump to Hold Off on Colombia Tariffs After Reaching Deal on Migrants
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
<article>US President Donald Trump announced tariffs on Colombia over a dispute about deported migrants, but then withdrew the threat a few hours later after reaching a deal with Bogota. The White House claimed victory on Sunday night, saying Colombia had “agreed to all of President Trump’s terms” without delay, including the acceptance of deportees on US military aircraft. Bill Faries reports on Bloomberg Television.
--------

items.title: China's DeepSeek Showcases Tech Advances Despite US Curbs
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
<article>China's DeepSeek has taken the world by surprise with its powerful model, showcasing advances in the country's AI technology despite US restrictions. The latest R-1 reasoning model has impressed users with how close the technology has caught up with those of US pioneers like OpenAI. Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Robert Lea explains what DeepSeek's rise means for its rivals.
--------

items.title: Trump Reiterates "No-Tax-on-Tips” Promise in Vegas Rally
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
<article>President Trump at a victory rally in Las Vegas, Nevada reiterated his campaign promised to eliminate taxes on tips.  He said this proposal would affect an estimated four million workers who depend on tip income, 700,000 of which are single moms.
--------

items.title: Trump threatening Canada makes no sense | Bloomberg Opinion
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
<article>Trump’s drive for US “energy dominance” is codependent on Canadian oil. Which is why his threat of tariffs against Canada makes no sense, explains Bloomberg Opinion columnist Liam Denning.
--------

items.content:

items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
<article>India's southern state Andhra Pradesh's Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu sat down with Bloomberg's Menaka Doshi to speak about global investment opportunities in the country and the green energy investment plans in the state. He spoke on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.

7:12 National ambitions</article>

items.title: #Tangen: Long-term investors should be widely diversified #Shorts
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
<article>Investors willing to go against the market in the coming months should consider selling US technology stocks and private credit, according to the head of Norway’s $1.8 trillion sovereign wealth fund.

#DavidRubenstein #BloombergHouse #Norway #wealth #wealthfund #wealthmanagement #investor #investing #USmarket #tech #technology #privatecredit #stocks #Davos #WEF #Davos2025 #WEF2025</article>

items.title: #netflix show puts Korean chefs in spotlight
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content: <article>In September, Seoul’s fine dining scene got a big boost with the premiere of hit Netflix cooking competition Culinary Class Wars. @sunny_newsiee reports on how the show continues to influence Korean diners and increase revenue for operators https://trib.al/NAw8ik5</article>
